intro: Scleranthus theodori, commonly known as Theodore's thornweed, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Geraniaceae family and typically grows in dry, rocky habitats. The plant features small, clustered flowers that are usually pink or purple in color. Its leaves are narrow and often have a slight pubescence. Scleranthus theodori is characterized by its hardy, resilient nature and ability to thrive in poor soil conditions.
